titleStmt.title: Ouranos kai tartaros= heaven and hell epitomized. The true Christian characterized. As also an exhortation with motives, means and directions to be speedy and serious about the work of conversion. By George Swinnocke M.A. sometime fellow of Baliol Colledge in Oxford, and now preacher of the Gospel at Rickmersworth in Hertfordshire.
titleStmt.author: Swinnock, George, 1627-1673.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by E.M. for Tho. Parkhurst, and are to be sold at the sign of the three Crowns at the lower end of Cheapside, over against the Conduit,

notesStmt.note: First three letters of title are in Greek characters.
Tightly bound; pages stained, with some print show-through.

place.placeName: the sign of the three Crowns at the lower end of Cheapside, over against the Conduit
